conclusion: Trace the path of the liquid from points A, B, and C through the baffles to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid starts at point A and encounters the first baffle angled downwards to the right.
Liquid from point A will follow the slope of the baffle and move towards the right.
Liquid from point A encounters the second baffle angled downwards to the left.
Liquid from point A will follow the second baffle downwards and to the left.
Liquid from point A reaches the third baffle angled downwards to the right.
Liquid from point A will move towards the right and reach the opening above container E.
Liquid from point A will flow into container E.
Liquid starts at point B and encounters the first baffle angled downwards to the left.
Liquid from point B will follow the slope of the baffle and move towards the left.
Liquid from point B encounters the second baffle angled downwards to the right.
Liquid from point B will follow the second baffle downwards and to the right.
Liquid from point B reaches the third baffle angled downwards to the left.
Liquid from point B will move towards the left and reach the opening above container D.
Liquid from point B will flow into container D.
Liquid starts at point C and encounters the first baffle angled downwards to the left.
Liquid from point C will follow the slope of the baffle and move towards the left.
Liquid from point C encounters the second baffle angled downwards to the right.
Liquid from point C will follow the second baffle downwards and to the right.
Liquid from point C reaches the third baffle angled downwards to the left.
Liquid from point C will move towards the left and reach the opening above container F.
Liquid from point C will flow into container F.
Final answer: Liquid from A will flow into container E, liquid from B will flow into container D, and liquid from C will flow into container F.
